msgSnippet: ... This is a ... your ... the ... Mock ... implementation ... more ... a lot ... What would you say is the advantage of DBUnit over the method my coworker
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, manuel.laflamme@o... wrote:
> I suggest you to take a look at DbUnit (http://www.dbunit.org/).
This is a
> JUnit extension targeted for database-driven projects that puts
your
> database into a known state between test runs.
>
> I usually use both Mock and DbUnit. I mostly use DbUnit to test
the
> Persistence Logic. Then the Business Logic can be tested with a
Mock
> implementation of the Persistence Logic or using the true
implementation
> with DbUnit. As described by Paul Christmann, the latter tests are
more
> Functional tests than Unit tests. Running Mock tests is obviously
a lot
> faster!
>
> Manuel Laflamme

What would you say is the advantage of DBUnit over the method my
coworker suggested (using JUnit with two custom methods for writing
test data in the database and deleting it after the test is run)?
